column4: I'm trying to connect to my WPA wireless network. Can anyone help me connect to it via the command line?
so far I've just tried to use iwconfig with a key to connect.. but that doesnt work.
do you need certificates for your wirelles lan? is you card working great?
No, no certificates required.. and I believe my card is working.. it can see all the wireless networks around me (over 30 of them).
ok so they seem to work...but can you tell me exactly what is happening to your connection?
I guess that I've still got to do the step of creating the wps_suppliment.conf file and stuff.. I'll read up on that.
ok so that might be your problem
is it strange that I have no /etc/wpa_supplicant.conf file? I can of course create one, but is it strange that it doesnt exist up front?
yeah you have to create it , this is the normal procedure
do you want an example file?
I think I got the example file.. so I've created it now, with my own network{} defined in there based on what wpa_passphrase gave me. What do I have to do next?
strange.. I just saw a program called wpa_cli exists.. when I run it it says 'Cound not connect to wpa_supplicant - re-trying'
u have to run the file with you against your conf file
